caption: You can get there by train and buy tickets on site. Their closing time 10 pm.  I recommend to get there at around 5 or 6 pm to observe the city from above and spot different places in Paris; then wait till dawn and see the Eiffel Tower lights spectacle at every hour from 7 pm for 5 min.  The rooftop definitely can be improved to make the experience more interesting.

Don't come here unless you have already visited most of Paris.  The view is excellent, all the highlights of the city are visible. The sunset is amazing, the view is great.  If you want to come, it's better if you have already visited all other landmarks of the city.

We bought advance tickets, no queues to get to the lift. Security checks in place. Great views of Paris from the top deck (some steps involved). We went in the daylight and at dusk to catch different scenes. Nice little cafe too.

Excellent experience, would recommend in the evening as its worth to see the city from above, get a fun photo taken and learn about the landscape of Paris from hundreds years ago on their VR Google upstairs. The platform outside gives you an amazing view of Paris.

ADA wheelchair ‚ôøÔ∏è accessible except that last floor which has 2 stories to climb.  Get tickets go lightly.  Beautiful 360 view of Paris.  A dinning venue on top floors.  Security wait times were long but worth it.  So glad we went.
Really cool even though it was a bit cloudy we still had a good view. The place is a little outdated and run-down and it would be great with more information of the landmarks around.
Absolutely amazing views!! Lift was so fast. I have a fear of heights but was fine on the inside,not so on the roof top ü§£ ‚Ä¶

Though the view of Paris from the 56th floor was quite exciting but the fact that the height of the building was equal to Eiffel tower obviously one did not feel too exciting. But the horizon looked like a canvas..
Visited this place with my family which was next to my hotel, Worth trying it out recommended to go closer to sunset so that you can have a better view of the city!

Must visit, awesome view over the city and Eifel tower, entrance is at the back and tickets are sold after the elevator. No time limit, lower floor is inside, upper floor is open to the elements but still well protected from the wind.
Not too crowded till sunset time. Lovely Cafe and gift store. Lots of photos opportunities with your group. Excellent way to watch the sunset.
Nice views of Paris and most important of Eiffel Tower. It wasn‚Äôt crowded at all. Ladies at the bar could have been a little more enthusiasticüá´üá∑

Hidden gift of height and perspective! It was a little hard to find. Ext 4 on the subway is closed, and it is a non distinct building. But once in the pics are endless, and don't skip the rooftop! It is so much cooler and fun pics to take. Cafe is lackluster, and the staff are meh...

Great to go with family or special one. There is a Terrace in the outside but also a small bar in the interior. Is the greatest view, because you will see the Eifell tower along with the view of all Paris. Try to stay until 9pm when the tower lights turn on. Not busy at all.

Amazing views and really helpful and kind staff. Loved that there was a video showing Paris as it was decades ago to present day. Recommend highly as if you brave the chaos at the Eiffel Tower, you can't obviously see it and it's much better to see it to take pictures.
This may be the single most useful thing to do when you first arrive in Paris. It gives an amazing overall perspective on the city that helps you navigate later!
The view is amazing. Definitely a must try. They play music on the viewing deck. There is a bar as well. You can watch an animated short movie how the city changed by the time.
Went for sunset, was a bit of haze but still spectacular

This is a great way to view the city from above. It‚Äôs a pity it is through the smudged and dirty glass with garish lights making photo taking difficult. The exhibition flying through time is a nice touch. It was a little crowded at times which was most noticeable when trying to get back down, but the elevator is super quick so you don‚Äôt have to wait too long. Go at 21:30 and you will see the Eiffel Tower sparkle at 22:00
A beautiful find. A perfect way to see the Paris skyline while sipping champagne.
Amazing location to visit, I picked sunset to get the best of both night and day

Recommend this attraction! I'm afraid of the heights a litlle but during the visit I felt safe. There were attenders who instructed the directions all the way. The elevator was safe and smooth ride. And the view was just amazing!
Perfect place to look at Paris from above but not from top of the Eifel tower.
Great view and no waiting line.
Amazing view, both indoors and outdoors!
Nice view, 21 euro / ticket on line, you must came with 30 min before , you have a line on the elevators

The virtual reality experiences are cool; just make sure you wipe them off before you use them or wash your face afterwards. There is an augmented reality app you can use on your phone if you want that kind of enhancement. The view itself is better than any picture or AR/VR experience; you REALLY need to see this view of Paris with your own eyes!

We got a great view of Paris including the Eiffel tower. The elevator ride up made us feel a little dizzy. We were pleasantly surprised that there were very few people at the Montparnasse when we visited. I'd recommend it. It's worth it but note there's an entrance fee to be paid.
Excellent place for wonderful photo opertunities.  Probably the best view of Paris France during the night or day.
good city view but if r here for eiffel tower view,the seine river cruise has a better view of it,we came April n the place around eiffel tower is cordon off for the coming Paris Olympics

Very cool view, neat VR experiences that showed Paris though the ages. It was like ‚Ç¨15 too expensive (‚Ç¨25) for an elevator ride, though, especially when 1/4 of the lower viewing area was blocked off due to a private event. Don't forget to take the stairs all the way to the top!

Excellent View of Paris. Quite pricey though, 19‚Ç¨ ! And prepare to take a ridiculous amount of stairs to access the deck. There's a bar serving beer and drinks at the deck so, sipping a beer will offer a different experience.
We are just in time to see the Eiffel tower turning lights on. The night view is magical. The Montparnasse cemetery is a sharp contrast to the rest of the illuminated city.
A good place for viewing the Eiffel Tower
Maybe the best place to see all of Paris, maybe even better than the Eiffel Tower itself, because from here you can see that, too.

Worth doing.  Even though the locals are not keen on this building and when you go there is does not seem to be the best entrance, but when you get up stairs it is so much better than you think it is going to be.  It is cheaper to buy in advance but we just walked up.

The best view you will ever get in all of Paris! The tower has a viewing platform which you can reach through express elevators and a few steps and the platform itself is covered from wind by huge glass sheets with viewing cutouts for cameras and binoculars (which there are a few of already installed and usable for one or two euros). They seem to also have installations to protect visitors from rain directly above the mentioned glass sheets and also through "curtains" over some parts of the platforms main area.  There are uncomfortable-looking but quite-comfortable-once-youre-seated red chairs which allow you to enjoy the sun without too much wind, which is great on sunny days. You should bring sun protection if you plan to stay there longer on sunny days as there isn't anything throwing shadows.  Again, the view onto every part of the city is excellent, this includes Sacre Coeur, the Eiffel tower, Louvre, Notre-Dame and more. For some, you may need a zoom-enabled camera or binoculars, but you can see everything.  For 15 euros, this is a must-visit.  A souvenir shop and restaurant is located a few floors below the platform but we didnt visit them.  There's also an inside area close to them which allows viewing most of the attractions during bad weather but I recommend going here only if there's at least less clouds so you get the nicest views from the top of the tower.  The platform is centered with some distance to the edges of the building so people afraid of heights shouldn't have problems staying here without being afraid. The elevators are closed (no glass elevators, also important for people afraid of heights).  Go here! You may regret it if you don't.  (Pictures are partly edited in color, saturation and such things)

Saw this recommended on Travel Man as an alternative to the Eiffel Tower. So glad we went up, especially recommend going up at nighttime - the views are amazing. You have to work to find the entrance, but if one set of doors don't open, keep walking around the building. You get to see lovely views of Paris at night for about ¬£20 per person. Best bit was walking past the HUGE queues for the Eiffel Tower the following day
